column2: west-long) is a town in eastern Mongolia and the capital of Sükhbaatar Province. The town with its vicinities creates a sum (district) of Sükhbaatar Province. The Baruun-Urt sum area is 59 km²
column5: population density 265 per km² (2008). It forms an enclave within the surrounding Sükhbaatar sum.

column1: Tömörtiin Ovoo Zinc Mine lies about 13 km north of the town.
The Baruun-Urt Airport (UUN/ZMBU) has one unpaved runway. There is a regular flight connecting the city to the capital every Monday. The flight is operated by the MIAT through Sky Horse Aviation.
